comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: ITExpert on May 31, 2023, 03:44:57 AMHi, I'm new to this platform but before I joined I ask some questions from Youtube and Google but did not clear my mind. What are the benefits of using bitcointalk? Is this only for Bitcoin investment persons only? As I know bitcoin and Digital currency are the Future. So how do I invest in Bitcoin and how to earn from it? First, welcome to the forum. This forum is officially a Bitcoin forum. Everything you need to know about Bitcoin, the new update, security issues, the best wallets to use, how to buy and sell, and how to protect your Bitcoin from being stolen can be learned by scrolling around the forum.Check through:  Bitcoin Discussion  Read through various topics regarding Bitcoin. Since you are still new to crypto, it will actually be good for you to familiarize yourself with what you want to invest your money in. You can also use other sources to acquire information when you don't see what you need here. You are always allowed to ask questions, and answers or suggestions will be given to you by experienced users. Wallet software   When you are done familiarizing yourself with a few things about Bitcoin, knowing the risk involved and that it's not a get-rich-quick scheme, and yet you finally decide to invest, the best thing I will advise you to do is to choose the best wallet that you will use to store your Bitcoin. Reading through that board, you will find lots of topics regarding different wallets and which is highly recommended. For a start, the electrum wallet is highly recommended here in this forum; it's open source and a self-custodial wallet. Read  [Newbie question] How to keep my Electrum wallet and BTC safe When you have chosen the wallet you need, I guess the next option is how to buy it and where to buy it from. If you are the privacy kind of person who doesn't want to share his or her identity with an unknown platform, I will suggest you go for a non-centralized means of buying, which is P2P. There are a lot of P2P options out there that you could possibly choose from . Agoradesk  is one of the best.  Kycnot.me,  Bisq

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: ITExpert on May 31, 2023, 04:05:04 AMThank You for your Reply I'm getting rich by doing investment in Bitocin but before I learn Bitcoin in deep how it works is there any trade discussion and Signals about Bitcoin? And what is Custodial dex and how do I buy Bitcoin in my local currency?Yes bitcoin do increases in price due to its volatility which makes it a very good ROI but this doesn’t make bitcoin a get rich quick scheme. If you’re in for that then you are easily prone to make mistakes. For you to gain you need to choose between holding or trading, the latter is more riskier than the former and it needs you to build on its knowledge. So my advice is if you are a total newbie stick only to holding first. The forum doesn’t by any chance approves signals, although there people that actually post some signals on the forum but do not trust any of it because it is on the forum. The more reason why people disregard this signals is because it is widely accepted that bitcoin isn’t predictable and the signals are just mere speculations based on past trends of bitcoin or the economic situation of the world. So believing the signals and investing base on there predictions is not advisable, rather you should do your research by gaining knowledge. Custodial means having everything in your own hands and not trusting anyone. The Dex means decentralized exchanges; these exchanges are those that do not require your details (KYC) when signing up on the platform and regarded the safest option if you’re into bitcoin or cryptocurrency for its privacy sake. You can actually buy from different exchanges but your country will depend on the most suitable exchange for you, so go through the local boards and look for that of your country and ask there or you can just mention your country here and someone will help you with lists of the exchanges
